title: Riot's New Balance Strategy
body:
Let 10 champions have win rates of 55%+.

Let 10 champions have win rates of 45%-.

There, they balance each other out!

replies.body:
Damn. We're at 50%. Not too shabby. 

While those two stats are not the only ones we focus on, I still think they might be exaggerating the situation.  Significantly.

Frist off, hilarious response, but when will graves receive a nerf? He currently holds the highest win rates in top and jungle and near the highest in ADC, and yet 4 patches after the adc reworks he has not been toned down. Is there a reason you guys think he is balanced right now? Just wondering!

Elewd and Angry Monster pointed out that we've got plans for him lined up on PBE.  Graves has a fairly interesting playstyle. He was a bit overtuned on release, and we tuned him down in a redeploy.  Players continued to get better at him and get more experience on him in different roles, which made him an even better pick.  

We clearly agree he deserves to be toned down. However, him being the highest win rate in 3 roles is something that only came to light in 6.1.

Dunno why people ask Rioters a question, berate the answer, then wonder why reds don't post in threads. Just want it to be known a lot of players appreciate the answers you give, even if we don't personally agree with them all the time.

Thanks! 

For the most part this is healthy discussion about the state of the game.  We do have a lot of topics flying about now, though. :)

You know the reason people get fed up with "balance" from Riot? Fiora/Graves have been, an admitted, problem for a while. Yet Swain was nerfed first. High play rate + strength should be nerfed before low play rate + strength.
Certain champs are easier to nerf and not gut over others. It just so happens that Swain was one of them.
and to make matters worse they downvote the comment calling them out as opposed to realizing they fucked up.

Let me ask you a serious question that will probably come off offensive.

How can you guys say Rengar was " embarrassing that Rengar exists in his current form" and then nerf him, but allow things like Kindred, Graves, Mundo,  etc. to continue being anti-fun and extremely strong? I really don't understand it because Rengar was not changed for a while and the meta was what made him strong with the removal of wards. THese other champs have been strong due to changes for a while. I'm not even a Rengar main/player and I felt somewhat insulted by those words.

Definitely didn't come off as insulting.  Rengar being an embarrassment was a Rioter's opinion.  Now, I happened to agree with it, so the point is kind of moot but one Rioter could be embarrassed with a number of things and it doesn't necessarily mean they're right or that we're changing it.

That was just kind of a preface that beats around the bush. The problem with Rengar, IMO, wasn't that he was ridiculously powerful or won a lot of games (though he was definitely getting on the high side).  The main issue was that when he was successful even HIGHLY skilled players could not react fast enough to his kill pattern.  

Of the champions you listed: we modified two, and are changing the third (Graves) next patch. And to be fair we also had a redeploy for Graves post 5.22 release to tone him down.  Still, I don't think any of those champions were on the same level as Rengar.

> [{quoted}](name=BlueEclipse,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=yR62KYr1,comment-id=000500000001000600000000000100000000,timestamp=2016-02-09T13:52:54.386+0000)

Lux's w shield and e skill hasn't counterplay.

>The main issue was that when he was successful even HIGHLY skilled players could not react fast enough to his kill pattern.

Here's the problem with that logic. If Rengar was this strong, then why was he almost never picked/banned in the LCS? I mean if even the highly skilled players can't react to him, why haven't teams thought of using him and getting all the kills onto him and then just destroying their opponents in pro play? Seems like it would be an amazing tactic if Rengar was indeed this strong.

>Still, I don't think any of those champions were on the same level as Rengar.

Same problem as above. Kindred, Fiora, Graves, Mundo are top tier picks right now in pro play and people are actually proving how strong they are, yet they seem to remain untouched so far. I honestly wouldn't care about the Rengar nerfs because I can see how he can be anti-fun, but these other champs are arguably worse and we have received no feedback on them besides on Graves

"If Rengar was this strong, then why was he almost never picked/banned in the LCS?"

Because the strategys that shut him down are tons of vision, safe play in lanes, team coordination and grouping, and early game strong counter jungling. All of which are what dominate the LCS fairly hard right now, especially with the current meta of constant lane swaps to tower trade. Additionally he's been non meta in pro play for a long while now and pros are slow to change champions.

Despite all that he is still seeing occasional pro play. But Riot doesn't balance mostly for pro play, they balance mostly for diamond+ non pro play. And there he's not only seeing a good bit of play but also has above average success and is very hard to stop once he gets even a little ahead. The counterplay to Rengar is to never let him get that little bit ahead, which requires that team work and safe play I mentioned above.

Pros aren't very interesting in champions who are feast or famine. They like safe picks. Picks that do a lot of work whether ahead or behind. If behind, Rengar falls off really hard and doesn't do much of anything.

The changes Riot made to him both nerfed and buffed him in ways that ideally make him less feast or famine. Giving him more damage in a longer fight, which can happen if he gets behind and builds a little tanky. But it also took away some of his extreme burst, meaning that even while ahead he doesn't just instakill people so easily.

>Because the strategys that shut him down are tons of vision, safe play in lanes, team coordination and grouping,

So you agree that Rengar has plenty of counterplay and that just because low elo kids who can't adjust their playstyle and lose because of it doesn't mean we should nerf that champ

>Despite all that he is still seeing occasional pro play. But Riot doesn't balance mostly for pro play, they balance mostly for diamond+ non pro play

Occasional? You mean once or twice this season? And no, Riot has stated that they balance around Plat +. My point was not about balancing around pro players. My point was that if Rengar is really THIS hard to react to even with good players, then he would be played more in the LCS

>Pros aren't very interesting in champions who are feast or famine. They like safe picks. Picks that do a lot of work whether ahead or behind. If behind, Rengar falls off really hard and doesn't do much of anything.

Another reason why Rengar was fine the way he was. He requires the enemy to make mistakes, so nerfing him because he one shots someone after being fed free kills makes 0 logical sense when you leave shit like Kindred or Fiora alone who don't need to be fed or capitalize on mistakes to win games

>Giving him more damage in a longer fight, which can happen if he gets behind and builds a little tanky.

Do you not see what is wrong with this sentence? Rengar isn't a bruiser. He is an all in single target ASSASSIN. Meaning he goes in, kills someone, and goes out. He has clear counterplay and is useless without kills/ult advantage. Changing him to a bruiser who stays in the fight longer n builds tankier will ruin his identity

I agree that Rengar has plenty of counterplay... if you're an LCS team (though even then it's not necessarily healthy gameplay). But even challenger players had trouble dealing with him before the 6.2 changes. His counterplay is at the team level, not the individual player level. And yet even team counterplay wasn't enough to keep him out of pro play.

Riot has said diamond+ multiple times. Though that's not all they balance for of course.

Everyone makes mistakes, requiring the enemy to make some for him to be good is good or bad depending on the details of how that all works. In a sense almost every champion requires that.

Rengar WAS an all in single target assassin, because that was the best way to use him, not because that's the only thing he could do. The change they made is to help him be a little less all in. He's still mostly a single target assassin, but now he takes a little longer to get the kill but does more damage by being alive longer. Gives the enemy more room to react, because insta killing people from out of nowhere is not ok.

>But even challenger players had trouble dealing with him before the 6.2 changes

Yet his winrate wasn't high (48%), he was never complained about and he wasn't touched for a while.

Then riot make warding harder and make it impossible to pink when full build and he became more annoying. Terrible logic to nerf him when the only problem was SOLO QUE and because you made it impossible to buy pinks at full build.

>Riot has said diamond+ multiple times.

Do your research, they said Plat+

>Everyone makes mistakes, requiring the enemy to make some for him to be good is good

But the mistakes you need to make in order for Rengar to work is really low elo mistakes such as not buying wards, spliting as a squishy alone, not peeling/grouping, etc.

Also with other champs you can abuse mistakes, but you can also outplay. GL outplaying with Rengar

>Rengar WAS an all in single target assassin, because that was the best way to use him, not because that's the only thing he could do. 

Yeah... that was his identity as a champion. A single target hunter. That's like saying Zed is an assassin because that's the only thing he does well. Yeah obviously that is his identity. Can you think of Zed becoming a bruiser? Would be stupid and wouldn't make sense. Either rework rengar into a bruiser or keep him as an assassin

"Yet his winrate wasn't high (48%), he was never complained about and he wasn't touched for a while.

Then riot make warding harder and make it impossible to pink when full build and he became more annoying. Terrible logic to nerf him when the only problem was SOLO QUE and because you made it impossible to buy pinks at full build."

Looking just at win rate isn't enough. He's been very strong for a while, but due to his ultimate he's simply MUCH stronger with highly coordinated team work. There have been complaints about him, though mostly in regards to his performance and prevalence in pro games.

"But the mistakes you need to make in order for Rengar to work is really low elo mistakes such as not buying wards, spliting as a squishy alone, not peeling/grouping, etc."

Utter bullshit. I've seen numerous pros playing in solo Q die to him in less than .5 seconds despite their team trying very hard to ward well and keep a spare pink in their inventory.

"Also with other champs you can abuse mistakes, but you can also outplay. GL outplaying with Rengar"

Are you serious? Have you read his passive? -_-

"Yeah... that was his identity as a champion. A single target hunter."

And it still is. But now he doesn't kill you in .3 seconds, he kills you in about 1.5 seconds early on, less if he gets fed enough.

"That's like saying Zed is an assassin because that's the only thing he does well. Yeah obviously that is his identity. Can you think of Zed becoming a bruiser? Would be stupid and wouldn't make sense. Either rework rengar into a bruiser or keep him as an assassin"

Except that Zed does like 20 things very well right now. Also he could easily make an amazing bruiser with a few simple changes... It would be awkward due to his current extremely light cc but he'd be like a juggernaut who trades cc for doing more damage and extreme mobility, which maybe just makes a fighter...? Anyways that's not the point.

Rengar actually makes a lot of sense as a bruiser with his current kit except for his ultimate. One of the weirdest yet highly effective builds in the game is 5 dorans blade + boots on rengar top then you start selling 1-2 blades at at time and get essentially fighter and juggernaut items. He becomes an extremely good split pusher.

>Looking just at win rate isn't enough. 

Win rate isn't everything, but it tells you a lot. 

>ultimate he's simply MUCH stronger with highly coordinated team work.

You do realize this is true for almost every single champ, right? You put Vel Koz in a highly coordinated team that peels for him he instantly seems broken as fuck. It's stupid to nerf a champ for this reason.

>Utter bullshit. I've seen numerous pros playing in solo Q die to him in less than .5 seconds despite their team trying very hard to ward well and keep a spare pink in their inventory

Show me a clip of a pro getting one shot by a Rengar while being grouped with his team and his team placing pinks once they see the ! and try to peel for him. You won't find one because usually those clips are the pros walking around by themselves in the jungle or csing alone.

>Are you serious? Have you read his passive?

What about it? Doesn't change anything. He's still a champ that relies heavily on mistakes being made against him. That is why he is good in solo que, but  you will rarely ever see him in pro player. People are less likely to walk around alone in pro play against a Rengar

>And it still is. But now he doesn't kill you in .3 seconds, he kills you in about 1.5 seconds early on, less if he gets fed enough.

Do you know what a bruiser is? Rengar's kit isn't like Zeds. Zed can press r, do his combo, then press r again and he is out free. Rengar jumps in and relies on his one shot or he will otherwise not get the kill because he will just get insta cc'd

>Except that Zed does like 20 things very well right now. Also he could easily make an amazing bruiser with a few simple changes.

I disagree. He would make an OK bruiser, but his Ult would be pretty useless. His kit revolves around him going in, killing someone, getting out. A bruiser Zed would get shit on by most champs

>Rengar actually makes a lot of sense as a bruiser with his current kit except for his ultimate. One of the weirdest yet highly effective builds in the game is 5 dorans blade + boots on rengar top then you start selling 1-2 blades at at time and get essentially fighter and juggernaut items. He becomes an extremely good split pusher.

Um what? 5 dorans blades is suicide unless you get fed with it early. No one should ever use it as an effective build unless they're 100% they will get fed, which is usually when you're against lower elo players. Rengar would make a terrible bruiser. It means his ult would be somewhat useless and just wouldn't make sense with his kit. 

And he is 100% not a "extremely good split pusher." Champs like Fiora and Jax can 1v2 late game and have a ton of mobility. Rengar thrives in 1v1 cutting people off and no escape if you buy pinks.

Look, I would understand if they nerfed Rengar AFTER nerfing all the actual broken shit like Fiora, Mundo, Tahm, Kindred, etc. But Riot completely ignores how strong these champs are and focus on Rengar? This is pathetic and shows how shitty their balance team is

> [{quoted}](name=Savage Bear,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=yR62KYr1,comment-id=000500000001000600000001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-02-14T00:14:50.322+0000)
> You do realize this is true for almost every single champ, right? You put Vel Koz in a highly coordinated team that peels for him he instantly seems broken as fuck. It's stupid to nerf a champ for this reason.

Actually it isn't. Alistar just requires your team to do what they already want to do, but while getting to ignore some of the potential negative consequences. Abilities that let you survive are generally much easier to play with, especially for your team mates. Abilities that let you kill people but don't let you do it completely alone require your team to hit the same target with damage or cc, which is simply much harder.

Locking someone in the right place at the right time with a Morgana Q to secure a kill is like 50 times harder than walking under an enemy turret and pressing R while next to an enemy on Alistar. Luckily Alistar's R is on a much longer cd.
> 
> Show me a clip of a pro getting one shot by a Rengar while being grouped with his team and his team placing pinks once they see the ! and try to peel for him. You won't find one because usually those clips are the pros walking around by themselves in the jungle or csing alone.

Are you trying to say that the way to not get killed by Rengar is to just permanently stay grouped as 5 with pinks and peel at the ready as if that's something you can actually maintain all the time? Seriously?

Most of the time early on you're not going to be grouped as 5 because it's not correct to do so. If you did you'd lose to doing that. Later on you should be grouped a bit more but you still can't be 5 people ready to go 100% of the time, and even if you are that doesn't necessarily stop a Rengar with some kills from one shotting one of your carries. I'm not hunting down specific videos for you, sorry.
> 
> What about it? Doesn't change anything. He's still a champ that relies heavily on mistakes being made against him. That is why he is good in solo que, but  you will rarely ever see him in pro player. People are less likely to walk around alone in pro play against a Rengar

The game isn't balanced solely around pro play. The vast vast VAST majority of players are not pros. Even so, you can't just assert that Rengar is fine because grouping as 5 with pinks is technically possible. Also Rengar with Ghostblade and swiftness boots can R and leap on you with almost 0 warning from the ! over your head. Well he could, but that's why they increased the range at which it appears now.
> 
> Do you know what a bruiser is? Rengar's kit isn't like Zeds. Zed can press r, do his combo, then press r again and he is out free. Rengar jumps in and relies on his one shot or he will otherwise not get the kill because he will just get insta cc'd

Rengar can press R, do his combo, and just walk away because you're dead. Or flash the wall and leap to a minion/jungle camp with his passive. Or just leap because you were near a bush and camp/minion when you died. Or stay because it's now 5v4 and the top damage carry on the enemy team is dead so Rengar isn't going to die before getting off another bit of damage.

Rengar pre nerfs was better at getting to your back line and killing your carry than Zed was. Zed can do it way too easily in my opinion, but Rengar could do it even better, which was very much not ok.
> 
> I disagree. He would make an OK bruiser, but his Ult would be pretty useless. His kit revolves around him going in, killing someone, getting out. A bruiser Zed would get shit on by most champs

Going in, killing someone, and then getting out is exactly what bruisers try to do... The difference with them and most assassins is that bruisers tend to kill you a little slower and be a little tankier. That's it.
> 
> Um what? 5 dorans blades is suicide unless you get fed with it early. No one should ever use it as an effective build unless they're 100% they will get fed, which is usually when you're against lower elo players. Rengar would make a terrible bruiser. It means his ult would be somewhat useless and just wouldn't make sense with his kit. 

I've seen it work in diamond games. It's not 100% going to get you fed, but it gives you a pretty good shot. I specifically said "except for his ult" when I said he'd make a decent bruiser.
> 
> And he is 100% not a "extremely good split pusher." Champs like Fiora and Jax can 1v2 late game and have a ton of mobility. Rengar thrives in 1v1 cutting people off and no escape if you buy pinks.

Rengar may not be a Fiora or Jax level of split pusher but he's still pretty good at it. He can escape a lot of 1v2s and even win some, ulting to get away if things get even worse than that.
> 
> Look, I would understand if they nerfed Rengar AFTER nerfing all the actual broken shit like Fiora, Mundo, Tahm, Kindred, etc. But Riot completely ignores how strong these champs are and focus on Rengar? This is pathetic and shows how shitty their balance team is

Except they did nerf Mundo, multiple times in recent patches in fact. They also nerfed Tahm last patch. They nerfed Fiora a while back and are nerfing her again next patch. Kindred has been nerfed a couple times, including in 6.22. I don't agree with all of the balancing Riot does, but I'm honest when they do stuff right, even if it takes longer than I'd like.

> [{quoted}](name=Savage Bear,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=yR62KYr1,comment-id=00050000000100060000000100000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-02-16T04:15:01.082+0000)
>
> My argument to this is the same. Why is Vel Koz not being nerfed? Clearly broken in highly coordinated teams!

The difference between Vel'Koz's ultimate done by a coordinated pro team and it done by a regular solo queued player isn't that big. A big part of this is the counterplay possible against his ultimate, which scales with player skill. Skilled players use Vel'Koz's ultimate better and skilled players play against it better. Alistar's ultimate leaves very little in terms of counterplay for the enemy team.
 
> Definitely not.  But that is how you play against a FED one. Or you can always keep the entire map warded and back off when you see him.

That 100% grouped as 5 for the rest of the game strategy is NEVER reasonable. You lose to a split push, even if it's just from a banner of commanded minion. Or you lose to Rengar STILL killing your carry despite your efforts, because he COULD do that in many cases. Also it's never reasonable to "keep the entire map warded."
 
> You don't have a team? So a squishy walkign around alone gets caught out by Rengar... you do realize that is what rengar is intended to do.

You don't always have ENOUGH team with you to not die. Sometimes your entire team isn't even enough. Other champions, even when fed, simply don't have the back line diving power of Rengar (at least before the latest changes to him). Why don't they? Because it's stupid, annoying, unfun, bullshit. That's why they changed Rengar. Get over it.
 
> That's what assassins do. Bruisers built half dmg half tank and focus on dueling more than one shotting the carries.

And that's what Rengar can do if built that way... shocker! /sarcasm
 
> You've seen Ryan Choi, which is a challenger OTP of Rengar succeed with it in Diamond games on his smurf. No one does that in diamond unless smurfing and even then that build is S4

No I've never seen Ryan Choi do anything. I've watched Nightblue3, Bengi, and more do it though.
 
> Step 1: buy a pink
> Step 2: Kill Rengar 
> EZ

Pinks don't stop his move speed bonus. At best they typically let you see him just as he leaves the pink's range and gets away. If not... then Rengar kills one of you first. Yeah, he could do that, despite your pink. Hence the changes.
 
> I named you literally a small portion of champs that are broken. And do you know how long it took for them to nerf these champs? They prioritized rengar nerfs of this shit. Pathetic from Riot

Actually several of those champions were nerfed before Rengar, a couple at the same time he was nerfed. and I think 2, maybe 3, were done ONE PATCH LATER. Rengar was less fun to deal with than those champions anyways. Except Fiora. Riot should've nerfed Fiora further like 3 patches ago at the very latest and they have no excuse for not doing so. I and many others are quite pissed about it.

>Actually it isn't. Alistar just requires your team to do what they already want to do, but while getting to ignore some of the potential negative consequences. Abilities that let you survive are generally much easier to play with, especially for your team mates. Abilities that let you kill people but don't let you do it completely alone require your team to hit the same target with damage or cc, which is simply much harder.

Locking someone in the right place at the right time with a Morgana Q to secure a kill is like 50 times harder than walking under an enemy turret and pressing R while next to an enemy on Alistar. Luckily Alistar's R is on a much longer cd.

My argument to this is the same. Why is Vel Koz not being nerfed? Clearly broken in highly coordinated teams!

>Are you trying to say that the way to not get killed by Rengar is to just permanently stay grouped as 5 with pinks and peel at the ready as if that's something you can actually maintain all the time? Seriously?

Udyr got a higher Winrate

I'm glad you said this, because the belief that winrates are the end-all explanation of gaming balance is completely out of hand.  People use it as an excuse for literally anything.  They don't realize the importance of dissecting other factors like Item Paths, Mastery Choices, Team Comps, Rune Builds, Familiarity and et cetera ad infitum.

As you already know, winrates are not a substitute for balance, they're just the end result of countless minute calculations.

Look, I agree with you. The winrate of a champ is NOT the end-all explanation of balance. However, I think that it IS a good start. 
Yes, there are TONS of other factors that can affect a champions power. Items, R+M, Team comps, and experience included. However, when ALL of this is taken into, if a champion is still sitting above 55%, they are likely to be a strong pick, if not OP (depending on how high they are above 55%). 

If a champion is ONLY powerful with ONE team comp, then their winrate is highly unlikely to be high. 
If a champion is only powerful with one type of team comp, then their winrate is highly unlikely to be high
---It is worth noting that meta has a lot to do with this. If a champ synergizes  very well with teams that have an assassin, and a tank, in an assassin meta, they are going to be really strong, since assassins are always used in an assassin meta, and top laners are usually tanks
If a champion is only powerful with one item, they are still likely to be powerful, cause they will just build that item every time they play. I mean would it be fair to say "All adc's are fair and balanced cause they need an IE or ER in order to do damage"? Most people don't call of item nerfs or removals (though I kinda want to see zhonyas leave).

Considering how many games are played, how many different R+M there can be, how many build paths there are, and team comps, if a champ is still able to maintain a winrate that is pretty high, then yes they are pretty strong.

If a champion has a really low winrate, then its a good indicator that they need buffs.
